Organisation Purpose Amount USD Country Programme Sub Programme Year Awarded Duration
National Alliance to End Homelessness To provide core support to the National Alliance to End Homelessness to further its mission of preventing and ending homelessness in the United States. Through research and data, the Alliance works to discover and build support for solutions for homelessness. It also works with partners to develop policy and resources to support solutions and builds local capacity to implement solutions. It works collaboratively with the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. 1'500'000.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Homelessness prevention 2015 59 months (1 Jul 2015-30 Jun 2020)
National Center for Child Abuse Prevention To provide core support to the NCCAP, which works to prevent child sexual abuse and exploitation in Moldova. NCCAPs vision is a society in which children are protected from all forms of violence. Its mission is to contribute to the reduction of violence against children though prevention activities, capacity development and specialised service provision. 469'104.00 Moldova Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Solutions and advancing action 2018 35 months (1 Dec 2018-30 Nov 2021)
National Center for Learning Disabilities To support NCLD to continue managing Understood.org, an online platform for parents of children who have learning and attention issues. This grant will also support the development of: a new online platform called Understood for Educators; and programming specific to young adults with learning differences. This will include leadership development and the creation of an advisory board of young adults. 3'000'000.00 United States Learning Differences 2017 35 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2020)
National Center for Special Education in Charter Schools To support NCSECS to develop and implement a communications strategy to provide data, analysis, guidance and insight to charter school authorisers, operators, state policy makers and others. This will ensure that charter schools in the United States are schools of choice for students, including those who learn differently. 599'999.00 United States Learning Differences 2018 35 months (1 Mar 2018-28 Feb 2021)
National Coalition Building Institute (NCBI) To support Youth Voices for Safe Homes of NCBI Switzerland to prevent various forms of domestic violence against children and youth in Switzerland. This project raises awareness among young people about their rights and empowers them to address and prevent various forms of domestic violence. This includes corporal punishments, sibling or parental conflicts, gender violence and intimate violence partnerships with their peers and relatives. NCBI is a Swiss organisation focused on violence prevention, prejudice reduction and intercultural integration. 213'542.00 Switzerland Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Preventing violence, protecting children 2016 36 months (1 May 2016-30 Apr 2019)

This project raises awareness among young people about their rights and empowers them to address and prevent various forms of domestic violence. This includes corporal punishments, sibling or parental conflicts, gender violence and intimate violence partnerships with their peers and relatives. NCBI is a Swiss organisation focused on violence prevention, prejudice reduction and intercultural integration. 213'542.00 Switzerland Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Preventing violence, protecting children 2016 36 months (1 May 2016-30 Apr 2019)
National Council for Civil Liberties (Liberty) To provide core support to Liberty to promote and build support for human rights among the public and policy makers in the UK and ensure a rights-compliant Brexit. Liberty will also work to ensure that policy related to minorities rights and surveillance is developed and implemented in accordance with international human rights standards. Liberty will litigate, campaign and advocate in pursuit of these objectives. 677'649.00 United Kingdom International Human Rights Broadening human rights constituencies 2017 23 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2019)
National Energy Action (Northern Ireland) To secure continuation of the Northern Ireland Sustainable Energy Programme for the next five years (2019 - 2024) and to ensure that 80 percent of the projected income from this programme (GBP 36million over five years) is dedicated to helping people living in fuel poverty. National Energy Action aims to reduce fuel poverty and advance education on energy conservation. 66'667.00 United Kingdom Housing and Homelessness Economic self-sufficiency 2018 11 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2019)
National Fair Housing Alliance To eliminate housing discrimination and to ensure equal housing opportunity for all people in the US. This will be done through leadership, education, outreach, membership services, public policy initiatives, community development and advocacy. NFHA is a consortium of more than 220 private, non-profit fair housing organisations, state and local civil rights agencies and individuals. NFHA works to create diverse, barrier-free communities across the US. 1'600'000.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Increasing the supply of low-income housing 2018 47 months (1 Aug 2018-31 Jul 2022)
National Housing Law Project To provide core support to the NHLP to limit the negative impact of current US federal housing policies through advocacy and strategic litigation. NHLP will also support the development of housing policies at the local level, which benefit low-income and vulnerable people. NHLP provides training and legal support to advocates throughout the US, to build capacity and influence. 1'500'000.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Homelessness prevention 2018 59 months (1 Nov 2018-31 Oct 2023)

National Low Income Housing Coalition To provide core funding to NLIHC which works to achieve socially just public policy that assures people with the lowest incomes in the United States have affordable and decent homes. NLIHC educates, organises and advocates to preserve existing federally assisted homes and housing resources, expand the supply of low income housing, and establish housing stability as the primary purpose of federal low income housing policy. 1'500'000.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Increasing the supply of low-income housing 2015 59 months (1 Dec 2015-30 Nov 2020)
National Network for Children Association To protect children from violence, including sexual violence, in Bulgaria. This will be achieved through a phased process of creating a movement to prevent violence against children, engaging key stakeholders and developing and implementing a nationwide strategy. The National Network for Children works to guarantee the rights of children and improve the wellbeing of Bulgarian families and children. 400'205.00 Bulgaria Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Preventing violence, protecting children 2017 35 months (01 Jan 2018-31 Dec 2020)

The goals are to: permanently close the Northern Bering Sea to bottom trawling; to lower by catch limits for halibut; and to include traditional knowledge in the North Pacific Fisheries Management Council. 590'000.00 United States Environment Marine 2018 35 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2021)

Nature Conservancy, The To tackle illegal, unregulated and unreported fishing at a global level with a special focus on policy in Japan. Illegal, unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing is a global problem that devastates marine ecosystems. By building strong partnerships between Japan, the EU, the US and the Pacific region, the Nature Conservancy aims to enhance the transparency of fisheries and strengthen the market for fish caught legally and sustainably. The Nature Conservancy works globally to protect land and water for nature and people. 1'000'000.00 United States Environment Marine 2017 35 months (01 Jul 2017-30 Jun 2020)
